theme.Question: Who said, 'A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out'?
theme.Explanation: Walter Winchell, a famous newspaper and radio gossip commentator, is credited with this enduring quote about the loyalty of real friends.

theme.Question: Which historical figure coined the phrase, 'A friend in need is a friend indeed'?
theme.Explanation: The origin of this proverb can be traced back to King Solomon's proverbs in the Old Testament, emphasizing the value of dependable friends.

theme.Question: Who is known for saying, 'There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship'?
theme.Explanation: Thomas Aquinas, an influential theologian and philosopher of the Medieval period, advocated for the immense value of genuine friendship in human life.

theme.Question: Which renowned author wrote, 'It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages'?
theme.Explanation: This insightful perspective on the significance of friendship within marriage is attributed to the influential German philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche.

theme.Question: Who is attributed with the quote, 'Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too? I thought I was the only one'?
theme.Explanation: This statement, capturing the essence of genuine connection in friendship, is famously linked to the renowned author and theologian C.S. Lewis.

theme.Question: Which philosopher expressed, 'Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit'?
theme.Explanation: Aristotle, the great Greek philosopher, emphasized the gradual development and nurturing required for the deep and meaningful bond of true friendship.

theme.Question: Who penned the words, 'There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met'?
theme.Explanation: Irish poet William Butler Yeats captured the essence of warm hospitality and inclusivity through this poetic expression about the potential for friendship in every encounter.

theme.Question: Which historical figure indicated, 'Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together'?
theme.Explanation: This sentiment, emphasizing the unifying force of friendship, is often associated with Woodrow Wilson, the 28th President of the United States.

theme.Question: Who famously iterated, 'Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend'?
theme.Explanation: The profound words of Martin Luther King Jr. highlight the transcendent power of love in transcending animosity and fostering friendship.

theme.Question: Which iconic literary figure emphasized, 'A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world'?
theme.Explanation: Renowned author and motivational speaker Leo Buscaglia conveyed the immense value of genuine friendship through this evocative analogy.

theme.Question: Who is credited with proclaiming, 'The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love'?
theme.Explanation: Hubert H. Humphrey, the 38th Vice President of the United States, emphasized the profound and rejuvenating effects of genuine friendship and love in this statement.

theme.Question: Which renowned philosopher conveyed, 'A friend is a second self'?
theme.Explanation: This profound notion of friendship as a mirror image of the self is attributed to the influential Greek philosopher Aristotle.

theme.Question: Who articulated, 'Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing'?
theme.Explanation: Nobel laureate and Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel delved into the profound impact of friendship, contrasting it with the potential pitfalls of love.

theme.Question: Which renowned poet expressed, 'Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life'?
theme.Explanation: Jean de La Fontaine, the eminent French poet, conveyed the deepening and enriching nature of friendship as life progresses through this metaphorical expression.

theme.Question: Who is known for asserting, 'Absence makes the heart grow fonder, but it sure makes the rest of you lonely'?
theme.Explanation: The creator of the beloved 'Peanuts' comic strip, Charles M. Schulz, wittily captured the bittersweet reality of the emotional impact of absence in this relatable quote.

theme.Question: Which literary legend expressed, 'A true friend is someone who is there for you when they would rather be anywhere else'?
theme.Explanation: Renowned comic book writer and editor Len Wein provided this poignant and relatable definition of true friendship through his impactful words.

theme.Question: Who advocated for the idea that, 'In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends'?
theme.Explanation: Martin Luther King Jr., in his written works and speeches, highlighted the profound impact of the support or lack thereof from friends during challenging times.

theme.Question: Which prolific writer expressed, 'A friend is one of the nicest things you can have, and one of the best things you can be'?
theme.Explanation: The sentiment of genuine friendship as a precious gift and a noble aspect of one's character is poignantly conveyed by author Douglas Pagels.

theme.Question: Who articulated, 'A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you'?
theme.Explanation: The profound sentiment regarding unconditional love and acceptance in true friendship is attributed to influential writer and philosopher Elbert Hubbard.

theme.Question: Which literary figure conveyed, 'A true soul mate is a mirror, the person who shows you everything that is holding you back'?
theme.Explanation: Author Elizabeth Gilbert, in her celebrated work 'Eat, Pray, Love', shared this profound reflection on the role of a true soul mate in growth and self-awareness.
